intro: Phyllanthus junceus, commonly known as the small-leaf phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in lowland areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
